intro.description: Welcome to the tutorial for creating a Model Plug-in in Whole. It will help you build a simple Model and try it out. You will create a Whole Plug-in project, and a Whole Model for a simple domain. Let's get started!

item.title: Open the Java Perspective
item.description: Select Window->Open Perspective->Java in the menubar at the top of the workbench. This step changes the perspective to set up the Eclipse workbench for Java development. You can click the "Click to Perform" button to have the "Java" perspective opened automatically.

item.title: Creating a Whole Plug-in Project
item.description: The first thing you will need is a Whole Plug-in Project. If you already have a Whole project in your workspace that you would like to use, you may skip this step by clicking the "Click to Skip" button. If not, select File->New->Project... and choose Whole->Whole Plug-in Project in the list. Complete the subsequent pages as required. The "New Whole Project" wizard is automatically displayed when you click the "Click to Perform" button.

item.title: Create your simple model
item.description: You should now have a Whole Project in your workspace. The next step in building your model is to create your HelloWorld model. You may do this by either clicking the "Click to Perform" button below to launch the New Java Class wizard, or you may use the Eclipse tools to do it, by using the File->New->Whole Model action. When you use the wizard, make sure that you specify the Language of your choice. If you do not use the "Click to Perform" button below, click the "Click to Skip" button to advance to the next step in building your hello world application.

item.title: Running the plug-in
item.description: Select Run->Run... Select 'Run-time Workbench' and create a new launch configuration for it. Accept the default and click Run. From the Welcome page, select "Go to the workbench". In the menu bar of the new runtime workbench click the new sample menu item and select the new sample action. This step will open a 'Hello, World' message box to indicate that the new plug-in is working properly. The "Run" shortcut is automatically created and executed when you click the "Click to Perform" button.

item.title: Deploying a plug-in
item.description: Select File->Export...->Deployable plug-ins and fragments and select the newly created plug-in in the list. This step packages the workspace plug-in in a format that will make it easily deployable in any Eclipse product. The "Deployable plug-ins and fragments" dialog is automatically displayed when you click the "Click to Perform" button.
